inputs.claim: India won the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup in 2023.

evidence.name: ESPN Cricinfo
evidence.result: India defeated Australia in the 2023 World Cup final to claim the title.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Tournament records confirm India lifted the 2023 trophy.

inputs.claim: The 2023 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Jon Fosse.

evidence.name: NobelPrize.org
evidence.result: Norwegian author Jon Fosse received the 2023 Nobel Prize in Literature.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Official Nobel records confirm the award.

inputs.claim: In 2024 the European Parliament formally approved the EU AI Act.

evidence.name: Politico EU
evidence.result: On March 13 2024, MEPs voted to adopt the landmark Artificial Intelligence Act.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Parliament voting records verify the Act’s approval.

inputs.claim: Japan’s H3 launch vehicle successfully reached orbit in March 2025.

evidence.name: JAXA Press Release
evidence.result: The H3 rocket placed its payload into orbit on March 7 2025.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: JAXA mission logs confirm orbital insertion.

inputs.claim: The Louvre was the most visited museum worldwide in 2024.

evidence.name: The Art Newspaper
evidence.result: The Louvre topped global visitor charts with 9.6 million visits in 2024.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Annual visitor statistics rank the Louvre first.

inputs.claim: The 2025 Tour de France will feature an individual time trial up Mont Ventoux.

evidence.name: CyclingNews
evidence.result: Route rumors suggest Ventoux could host a time‑trial, but ASO has not released the official 2025 route.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Route details are unconfirmed until ASO’s official announcement.

inputs.claim: The European Central Bank will cut interest rates in June 2025.

evidence.name: Financial Times
evidence.result: Analysts are divided; the ECB has given no firm guidance on a June cut.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Future monetary‑policy decisions remain undecided.

inputs.claim: Marvel Studios will release 'Avengers: Secret Wars' as a two‑part film in 2026.

evidence.name: Variety
evidence.result: Studio insiders mention possible two‑part structure, but no official release plan exists.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Release format and date are speculative at this stage.

inputs.claim: The EU’s planned 2035 ban on new internal‑combustion cars will be postponed.

evidence.name: Reuters
evidence.result: Some member states seek delays, but the European Commission has not amended the 2035 target.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Policy negotiations are ongoing; no official postponement.

inputs.claim: NASA’s Artemis III mission will land astronauts on the lunar south pole in 2027.

evidence.name: NASA
evidence.result: NASA schedules Artemis III for no earlier than 2027, but slips remain possible.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Launch date and landing site could change as schedules evolve.

inputs.claim: The 2024 US presidential election was won by an independent candidate.

evidence.name: AP News
evidence.result: The 2024 US presidential election was won by the Republican Party candidate.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Evidence contradicts the claim; the winner was not an independent.

inputs.claim: Lionel Messi retired from international football in 2024.

evidence.name: ESPN
evidence.result: As of March 2025, Lionel Messi continues to play for Argentina’s national team.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Messi is still active in international football according to the latest reports.

inputs.claim: The 2025 Academy Award for Best Picture was won by a foreign-language film.

evidence.name: Variety
evidence.result: The 2025 Academy Award for Best Picture went to a U.S.-produced film.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Award records show the winning film was not foreign-language.

inputs.claim: Ukraine regained full control over Crimea in 2025.

evidence.name: BBC
evidence.result: As of April 2025, Crimea remains under Russian control.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: No confirmed reports of Ukraine regaining full control over Crimea.

inputs.claim: NASA plans a crewed Mars mission for 2030.

evidence.name: NASA
evidence.result: NASA aims for a crewed Mars mission in the early 2030s, potentially after 2031.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Timelines are speculative and not officially confirmed for 2030.

inputs.claim: The 2024 Summer Olympics were hosted by Paris.

evidence.name: Olympics.com
evidence.result: Paris hosted the 2024 Summer Olympic Games.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms Paris as the host city.

inputs.claim: China landed a rover on the far side of the Moon in 2024.

evidence.name: SpaceNews
evidence.result: China's far-side lunar mission is scheduled for late 2026.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Planned mission has not occurred yet as of 2024.

inputs.claim: The 2025 Grammy Award for Album of the Year was awarded to a debut artist.

evidence.name: Rolling Stone
evidence.result: The winner of the 2025 Grammy for Album of the Year had released two previous albums.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: The winner was not a debut artist according to release history.

inputs.claim: Inflation in the Eurozone dropped below 2% in early 2025.

evidence.name: ECB
evidence.result: Eurozone inflation rate in Q1 2025 averaged 2.6%.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Evidence shows inflation remained above 2%.

inputs.claim: The 2024 Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to a climate activist.

evidence.name: NobelPrize.org
evidence.result: The Nobel Peace Prize in 2024 went to a coalition promoting press freedom.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Recipient focus was on journalism, not climate activism.

inputs.claim: Apple launched its first foldable iPhone in 2025.

evidence.name: TechCrunch
evidence.result: Apple has not officially released a foldable iPhone as of April 2025.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: No official product launch reported as of the date.

inputs.claim: The 2025 Cannes Film Festival awarded Best Director to a woman.

evidence.name: Cannes Official Website
evidence.result: The Best Director award in 2025 went to a female filmmaker.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Official festival sources confirm a woman won the award.

inputs.claim: Joe Biden is seeking re-election in 2024.

evidence.name: CNN
evidence.result: Joe Biden formally announced his 2024 re-election campaign.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Official announcement confirms his candidacy.

inputs.claim: The UK rejoined the European Union in 2025.

evidence.name: The Guardian
evidence.result: The UK remains outside the EU as of April 2025.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Current political status confirms the UK has not rejoined the EU.

inputs.claim: Taylor Swift announced retirement from music in 2025.

evidence.name: Billboard
evidence.result: Taylor Swift announced a new album and tour for 2025.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Ongoing musical projects contradict retirement rumors.

inputs.claim: Qatar hosted the 2023 Asian Cup final.

evidence.name: Al Jazeera
evidence.result: Qatar hosted the 2023 AFC Asian Cup final in Lusail.

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Confirmed by official tournament records.

inputs.claim: France won the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

evidence.name: FIFA
evidence.result: Argentina won the 2022 FIFA World Cup by beating France in the final.

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: France reached the final but lost to Argentina.

inputs.claim: A new Picasso painting was discovered in Spain in 2024.

evidence.name: El País
evidence.result: Experts are investigating a previously unknown artwork possibly by Picasso found in Madrid.

outputs.label: unknown
outputs.justification: Authenticity is still under investigation, no official confirmation yet.

inputs.claim: Water boils at 100°C at sea level.

evidence.name: Wikipedia
evidence.result: Water's boiling point at sea level is 100°C

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms the claim.

inputs.claim: The capital of France is Madrid.

evidence.name: Wikipedia
evidence.result: The capital city of France is Paris

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Madrid is the capital of Spain, not France.

inputs.claim: Vaccines cause autism.

evidence.name: CDC
evidence.result: No credible scientific evidence links vaccines to autism

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Extensive research disproves any link between vaccines and autism.

inputs.claim: Gold melts at 1064 degrees Celsius.

evidence.name: Encyclopedia Britannica
evidence.result: The melting point of gold is exactly 1064°C

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms the melting point of gold.

inputs.claim: The Earth is 4.6 billion years old.

evidence.name: NASA
evidence.result: Radiometric dating estimates Earth’s age to be around 4.6 billion years

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Scientific consensus and dating methods confirm this age.

inputs.claim: Humans use only 10% of their brains.

evidence.name: Scientific American
evidence.result: Neurological studies show humans utilize most of their brain regions daily

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Neurological evidence disproves this popular myth.

inputs.claim: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.

evidence.name: National Geographic
evidence.result: Lightning frequently strikes tall structures repeatedly

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Documented cases of repeated lightning strikes disprove this claim.

inputs.claim: Coffee stunts growth.

evidence.name: Mayo Clinic
evidence.result: No scientific evidence links coffee consumption to growth suppression

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: No scientific studies support this claim.

inputs.claim: Great white sharks are mammals.

evidence.name: Marine Biology Journal
evidence.result: Great white sharks are fish, specifically cartilaginous fish

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Sharks are classified as fish, not mammals.

inputs.claim: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the Earth's oxygen.

evidence.name: National Geographic
evidence.result: The Amazon rainforest contributes approximately 6-9% of global oxygen production

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Actual scientific estimates are significantly lower than 20%.

evidence.result: Water's boiling point at sea level is 100°C

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Evidence explicitly confirms the claim.

evidence.result: Great white sharks are fish, specifically cartilaginous fish

outputs.label: false

evidence.name: National Geographic
evidence.result: The Amazon rainforest contributes approximately 6-9% of global oxygen production

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Actual scientific estimates are significantly lower than 20%.

inputs.claim: Bananas grow on trees.

evidence.name: Britannica
evidence.result: Bananas grow on large herbaceous flowering plants, not trees

outputs.label: false
outputs.justification: Bananas grow on plants that are technically herbs, not trees.

inputs.claim: Albert Einstein won a Nobel Prize in Physics.

evidence.name: NobelPrize.org
evidence.result: Albert Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921

outputs.label: true
outputs.justification: Historical records confirm Einstein's Nobel Prize.
